space.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the amount of an area, room, container etc that is empty or available to be used
space.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: How much space is there on each disk?
The hedge takes up too much space.
Now that we’ve got three kids, it’d be nice to have a bit more space.
In small homes, a single colour scheme can create a sense of space.
There’s space for a table and two chairs.
He had plenty of space to study.
space.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: an area, especially one used for a particular purpose
space.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: a supermarket with 700 free parking spaces
the factory’s floor space (=the size of the available floor area)
We really do need more storage space.
space.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: an empty place between two things, or between two parts of something
space.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: There was an empty space where the flowers had been.
the space between the house and the garage
space.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: the area beyond the Earth where the stars and planets are
space.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: creatures from outer space (=far away in space)
Who was the first American in space?
space.translation[0].definitions[3].note: ‘the space’ in this meaning You say
One day people will live in space
One day people will live in the space
space.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: all of the area in which everything exists, and in which everything has a position or direction
space.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: the exact point in space where two lines meet
how people of other cultures think about time and space
space.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: within a particular period of time
space.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: Mandy had four children in the space of four years.
space.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: They achieved a lot in a short space of time.
space.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: land, or an area of land that has not been built on
space.translation[0].definitions[7].exam: a pleasant town centre with plenty of open space
the wide open spaces of the prairies
the loss of green space in cities
space.translation[0].definitions[8].defi: the freedom to do what you want or do things on your own, especially in a relationship with someone else
space.translation[0].definitions[8].exam: We give each other space in our marriage.
She needed time and space to sort out her life.
space.translation[0].definitions[9].defi: an empty area between written or printed words, lines etc
space.translation[0].definitions[9].exam: Leave a space after each number.
space.translation[0].definitions[10].def: the width of a typed  letter of the alphabet
space.translation[0].definitions[10].exa: The word ‘the’ takes up three spaces.
space.translation[0].definitions[11].def: a place provided for you to write your name or other information on a document, piece of paper etc
space.translation[0].definitions[11].exa: Please write any comments in the space provided.
space.translation[0].definitions[12].def: the amount of space in a newspaper, magazine, or book that is used for a particular subject
space.translation[0].definitions[12].exa: The story got very little space in the national newspapers.
space.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 3: an empty place between two things, or between two parts of something
space.translation[0].note_box[0].section: There was only a small space between the car and the wall.
Nathan stood in the doorway, filling the narrow space.
It was difficult being together in such a confined space.
Another day we returned to find an empty space where the TV should have been.
Write your refund request in the blank space on Line 9.
Jack cleared a space for his newspaper on the table.
Leave a space for the title at the top.
Decide what kind of table and chairs will fit best into the space.
space.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 4: the area beyond the Earth where the stars and planets are
space.translation[0].note_box[1].section: Meteorites are rocks from outer space.
The probe will continue its journey into deep space.
What will space travel be like in the future?
They are developing robots that can be used for space exploration.
The institute is a world leader in space research.
This technology was originally developed by the American space program.
Light takes time to travel across the vast reaches of space.
space.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to arrange objects or events so that they have equal spaces or periods of time between them
space.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: They used three microphones spaced several yards apart.
Try to space out your classes and study in between.
For security, use three evenly spaced bolts per post.
space.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to stop paying attention and just look in front of you without thinking, especially because you are bored or have taken drugs
space.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: I completely spaced out during the lecture.
space.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: the area or amount of room in a newspaper, magazine etc that is used for a particular subject
space.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: land or an area of land that has not been built upon
space.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: It has an attractive town centre with lots of open spaces.
